title: Sequoia & Kings Canyon National Parks: Sentinel Campground
body: Sentinel Campground       Sentinel Campground is located on Highway 180, ¼ mile from Cedar Grove Village. The campground is situated in the canyon along the South Fork of the Kings River under open stands of evergreen trees.     Region   Cedar Grove area in King Canyon     Elevation   4,600 ft. (1,402 m)     Open   April 28 - November 14, 2016     Reservations   No reservations; first-come, first-serve     Fee   $18/night     Number of sites   82     RV/Trailer  length   Varies     Hookups   None    Generator hours Use from 9 a.m. - 9 p.m. only!    Pets   Permitted (Learn more about pet regulations)     Dump station   None. Nearest dump station (summer only): Princess Campground (Hwy 180 at Hume Lake junction) in Sequoia National Forest     Groceries, showers, laundry   ¼ mile at Cedar Grove Village     Accessibility         Ranger Programs   July to early September     Phone   1/4 mile at Cedar Grove Village     Restrooms   Flush toilets     Food storage   Metal food locker - 48"W x 34"D x 28"H     Nearby Attractions   Horseback riding     You are required to store food properly in order to protect bears. Learn more about bears and food storage in the parks. Download the Sentinel campground map for a larger, printable image. (PDF)
